attributes.comment:
Adoption is an important way for people to grow their families and for children to
find homes. The cost of adoption is ever increasing and although the government
does offer a generous tax credit to defray the cost of adoption, many families are
still left towing a much greater line than those able to have biological children.
Particularly troubling is the proposed increase in USCIS fees affecting adoptive
families. Many of these fees support documents that must be renewed due to
increased waiting times for many programs. Even the current fees are difficult for
families to have to pay twice. Increasing them will only create further financial
hardship on those looking to expand their families and offer a home to a child who
might otherwise not have one. I ask you to consider any alternative possible not
to increase these fees.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Sarah M. Gannaway
